skill.name: geo-database
skill.description: Access NCBI GEO for gene expression/genomics data. Search/download microarray and RNA-seq datasets (GSE, GSM, GPL), retrieve SOFT/Matrix files, for transcriptomics and expression analysis.
skill.summary: Access NCBI GEO for gene expression/genomics data. Search/download microarray and RNA-seq datasets (...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill for accessing NCBI GEO database. Static analysis flagged 256 pattern-based issues but all are false positives. The 'backtick execution' findings are markdown code block syntax, not actual shell commands. Network operations are legitimate NCBI API access. FTP downloads target public GEO data repositories. Optional API key usage follows NCBI best practices. No executable code present - only documentation.

content.user_title: Access NCBI GEO gene expression data
content.value_statement: Researchers need efficient access to gene expression datasets for analysis. This skill enables querying, downloading, and analyzing data from NCBI's GEO database containing millions of genomics samples.
actual_capabilities: Search GEO datasets by keywords, organism, or experimental conditions
Download expression matrices and metadata using GEOparse or E-utilities
Parse SOFT and MINiML file formats for downstream analysis
Perform differential expression analysis with statistical methods
Batch process multiple datasets for meta-analysis workflows
limitations: Requires internet connection for accessing NCBI GEO servers
Large datasets require significant disk space and memory
NCBI rate limits apply without free API key (3 req/s vs 10 req/s)
Some older datasets lack complete matrix files

use_cases.title: Analyze gene expression in disease
use_cases.description: Download and compare gene expression data between healthy and diseased tissue samples to identify biomarkers.

use_cases.title: Meta-analysis across studies
use_cases.description: Combine data from multiple GEO studies to increase statistical power for detecting gene expression changes.

use_cases.title: Build predictive models
use_cases.description: Use GEO expression data to train machine learning models for drug response prediction or patient stratification.

prompt_templates.title: Search GEO datasets
prompt_templates.prompt: Search GEO for human breast cancer gene expression datasets from the last 5 years. Show the top 5 results with sample counts and platforms used.

prompt_templates.title: Download expression data
prompt_templates.prompt: Download the expression matrix and metadata for GSE12345. Save the files to ./data/ and show a summary of the dataset including number of samples and genes.

prompt_templates.title: Differential expression
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform differential expression analysis on GSE12345 comparing treatment vs control samples. Use limma or t-test and show the top 10 most significant genes.

prompt_templates.title: Batch processing
prompt_templates.prompt: Download and process these 3 GEO series: GSE100001, GSE100002, GSE100003. Extract expression data and create a summary table with study metadata.

output_examples.input: Search for diabetes gene expression datasets in humans
output: Found 1,247 datasets matching 'diabetes AND Homo sapiens'
- GSE12345: Type 2 diabetes gene expression (47 samples)
- GSE11111: Insulin response time course (24 samples)
- Title: Transcriptome profiling of diabetic vs normal kidney
- Platform: GPL570 (Affymetrix Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0)

best_practices: Always set your email when using NCBI E-utilities (required by NCBI policy)
Obtain a free API key from NCBI for increased rate limits (10 req/s vs 3 req/s)
Cache downloaded GEO files locally to avoid repeated downloads
anti_patterns: Do not download entire GEO database - be selective with accessions
Do not hardcode API keys in shared or version-controlled code
Do not ignore sample metadata when interpreting expression data

faq.question: Do I need an API key for GEO access?
faq.answer: API key is optional but recommended. Without key: 3 requests per second. With key: 10 requests per second. Get free key at ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/account/

faq.question: What is the difference between GSE, GSM, and GPL?
faq.answer: GSE is the complete study (series), GSM is an individual sample, GPL is the microarray or sequencing platform. Use GSE for full datasets.

faq.question: Why is expression data missing for some series?
faq.answer: Older submissions may lack matrix files. Download family SOFT file or parse individual sample tables for complete data.

faq.question: How do I handle very large GEO datasets?
faq.answer: Use FTP downloads for bulk data, process in chunks, and use sparse matrices for memory efficiency with sparse expression data.

faq.question: Can I use GEO data for clinical research?
faq.answer: Yes, GEO data is public domain. Always cite original studies and verify data quality before clinical applications.

faq.question: What file format should I use for expression data?
faq.answer: Series matrix files are fastest for expression values. Use SOFT for complete metadata. Use MINiML for XML-based processing needs.
